title: Claudio Ranieri is being awarded a GOLDEN BENCH by the Italian Football Federation
text:
Claudio Ranieri is being awarded a GOLDEN BENCH by the Italian Football Federation As far as awards go, this one is pretty unique Share We miss this happy face (Photo: Plumb Images) Share Get daily   
Mocked by the masses when he was appointed Leicester City manager , he shoved it right back in their faces when he defied 5,000/1 odds to win the most unlikely of Premier League titles. 
Fast forward a few months and the infectious smile was being wiped off his face. 
Leicester's title defence never got off the ground, eventually leading to his sacking in February - and they've been flying ever since. (Photo: Clive Rose) The trophy everyone wants to win... (Photo: Getty) 
But despite his woes this season, the Italian Football Federation have seen fit to award the 65-year-old with one of the most brilliantly random looking trophies in world football: a Panchina d'Oro, also known as the Golden Bench. 
The annual title is usually given to the Serie A coach of the season, but Ranieri will be a special exception. (Photo: Getty) Antonio Conte was delighted when he picked up the award (Photo: Getty) 
An Italian FA statement about the news said: "During the ceremony a special Golden Bench will be given to Claudio Ranieri, the protagonist of the extraordinary journey by Leicester, with whom he won the Premier League." 
Previous winners of the unique award include Antonio Conte and rumoured Arsenal target Massimiliano Allegri. 
The mini bench will sit on Claudio's mantelpiece alongside his coach of the year awards from the BBC and FIFA, which he won in December and January respectively. See, Claudio? It's not all bad this season... poll loading Were Leicester City right to sack Claudio Ranieri? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
